instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P3V3S3_EN: What is P3V3S3_EN? P3V3S3_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_S3 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, has green light on charger (just noticed stays green ??) no fan spin missing <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL> (no short to ground) at <TRANSISTOR>Q7903</TRANSISTOR> which if im right comes from <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> , i dont seam to have any of the power rails from <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> (S3 rails) , mmm now im confused or am i just going to lose with this one as that seams to come from the cpu , board had minor liquid spill but does have signs of being worked on before

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Green light staying green is normal on these antiques. Also you need to manually power them on by shorting the power pads on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>. If there is still no power check voltage on both pins of Y2810.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hi Duke on pin 1 (<SIGNAL>RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN</SIGNAL>) i get 1.6v and on pin 2 (<SIGNAL>RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT</SIGNAL>) i get  1.75v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: now i feel stupid -:) shorting the pads turns it on , thanks duke i will be sure to remember that one
